intro: Buchnera tetrasticha, commonly known as the four-angled bough plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, four-angled stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. The plant is native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Buchnera tetrasticha is valued in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties.
